body:
inAs the error "_ValueError: path must be a filename, not a directory_" suggests, the doccano task cannot find the required .env file.

If there is no .env file created when executing doccano init (or at the wrong location), you can circumvent the issue by creating the .env file manually e.g., in your doccano folder with the following content:

```
# platform settings
ADMIN_USERNAME=admin
ADMIN_PASSWORD=password
ADMIN_EMAIL=admin@example.com

# rabbit mq settings
RABBITMQ_DEFAULT_USER=doccano
RABBITMQ_DEFAULT_PASS=doccano

# database settings
POSTGRES_USER=doccano
POSTGRES_PASSWORD=doccano
POSTGRES_DB=doccano

# Flower settings
FLOWER_BASIC_AUTH=""
```

Then, execute the doccano task by pointing to the .env file

```
doccano task --env_file doccano/.env
```

issue.title: can't execute 'doccano task'

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
My Environment
---------
*   Operating System: Windows
*   Python Version Used: 3.8.10
*   When you install doccano: 2022/11/30
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): 

- doccano task
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "D:\IT\python\python38\lib\runpy.py", line 194, in _run_module_as_main
    return _run_code(code, main_globals, None,
  File "D:\IT\python\python38\lib\runpy.py", line 87, in _run_code
    exec(code, run_globals)
  File "D:\IT\python\python38\Scripts\doccano.exe\__main__.py", line 7, in <module>
  File "D:\IT\python\python38\lib\site-packages\backend\cli.py", line 174, in main
    env.read_env(args.env_file, recurse=False, override=True)
  File "D:\IT\python\python38\lib\site-packages\environs\__init__.py", line 409, in read_env
    raise ValueError("path must be a filename, not a directory.")
ValueError: path must be a filename, not a directory.

body:
> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51845996/204755833-19bc69ae-1158-4e64-80c8-6d61b2ca7e32.png)

I have avoided this mistake now.
1. Download the sqlite3.def file from the SQlite official website and put it in the python DLLs folder.
2. Uninstall version 1.8.2 docanno
3. Delete django in the site packages folder_ celery_ Results and django_ celery_ results-2.2.0.dist-info
4. Delete the C:  Users  xxx  doccano folder
5. Install version 1.6.2 of docanno

> As the error "_ValueError: path must be a filename, not a directory_" suggests, the doccano task cannot find the required .env file.
> 
> If there is no .env file created when executing doccano init (or at the wrong location), you can circumvent the issue by creating the .env file manually e.g., in your doccano folder with the following content:

> ```
> # platform settings

>

> ```
> 
> Then, execute the doccano task by pointing to the .env file
> 
> ```
> doccano task env_file doccano/.env
> ```

doccano task env_file doccano/.env
usage: doccano.exe [-h] {init,migrate,createuser,webserver,task,flower,help} ...
doccano.exe: error: unrecognized arguments: env_file doccano/.env

> As the error "_ValueError: path must be a filename, not a directory_" suggests, the doccano task cannot find the required .env file.
> 
> If there is no .env file created when executing doccano init (or at the wrong location), you can circumvent the issue by creating the .env file manually e.g., in your doccano folder with the following content:
> 
> ```
> # platform settings
> ADMIN_USERNAME=admin
> ADMIN_PASSWORD=password
> ADMIN_EMAIL=admin@example.com
> 
> # rabbit mq settings
> RABBITMQ_DEFAULT_USER=doccano
> RABBITMQ_DEFAULT_PASS=doccano
> 
> # database settings
> POSTGRES_USER=doccano
> POSTGRES_PASSWORD=doccano
> POSTGRES_DB=doccano
> 
> # Flower settings
> FLOWER_BASIC_AUTH=""
> ```
> 
> Then, execute the doccano task by pointing to the .env file
> 
> ```
> doccano task env_file doccano/.env
> ```



1. doccano folder should locate in your user directory and contains a sqlite file if you are using the default setting.
2. the command should be `doccano task --env_file doccano/.env`

> 
> 1. doccano folder should locate in your user directory and contains a sqlite file if you are using the default setting.
> 2. the command should be `doccano task --env_file doccano/.env`

Thank you very much. The command 'doccano task --env_file doccano/.env'  was executed successfully！

Hello guys, I had the same issue. I was trying to install doccano tool using pip and had the same issue with doccano task. So i have debug the code and found that there is a minor mistake in code.
So please go to env/Lib/site-packages/environs/init.py and go to 398 number line and change if path is None: to if path is '':
and try again with doccano task. it should work.
Hope it helps. Happy labeling :-)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26756126/205100556-d056a6ca-304b-419d-bab9-72006c8edc70.png)

> Hello guys, I had the same issue. I was trying to install doccano tool using pip and had the same issue with doccano task. So i have debug the code and found that there is a minor mistake in code. So please go to env/Lib/site-packages/environs/init.py and go to 398 number line and change if path is None: to if path is '': and try again with doccano task. it should work. Hope it helps. Happy labeling :-) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26756126/205100556-d056a6ca-304b-419d-bab9-72006c8edc70.png)

yeah,it works.but it mentions that 
`F:\Anaconda3\envs\doccano\lib\site-packages\environs\__init__.py:398: SyntaxWarning: "is" with a literal. Did you mean "=="?
  if path is '':`

> > Hello guys, I had the same issue. I was trying to install doccano tool using pip and had the same issue with doccano task. So i have debug the code and found that there is a minor mistake in code. So please go to env/Lib/site-packages/environs/init.py and go to 398 number line and change if path is None: to if path is '': and try again with doccano task. it should work. Hope it helps. Happy labeling :-) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26756126/205100556-d056a6ca-304b-419d-bab9-72006c8edc70.png)

yes its same thing right? if path=='': or if path is '': 
basically path was empty string not None. thats why it was not working.
